authors: A collection derived from the web community (Reddit,Pinterest,DmsGuild,ecc.). For credits, authors are provided with a web link in the entity description

entries: "It's a Trap!" - Admiral Ackbar.Deceptive Doublebluff. Animated traps are a masterstroke of object animation, people tend to treat them with caution up until they are disarmed; Once "disarmed" an animated trap can catch opponents truely off guard.Used by spellcasters who do not want to be disturbed and have a sick sense of humour; The animated trap is used for self defense and psychological warfare.Tricky Traps. Animated traps left to their own devices will attempt to follow whatever orders they were left last which is usually some combination of: Hide, Ambush and Attack.Animated traps hide themselves after successfully killing, moving away from the bodies as not to indicate their location.Constructed Nature. The trap doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.Monster a Day A194 by 1d6AdventurersTome of Madness Vol1, p21

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: he trap is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the trap must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the trap has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the trap scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the trap remans motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The trap is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The trap deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the trap that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the trap doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Thieves' Tools Susceptibility
entries: If targeted by thieves' tools, The trap makes a Constitution saving throw contested by the opposing creature's thieves' tools check. If the trap wins it can make a bite attack as a reaction against the opposing creature. If the trap loses it is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
Additionally if the trap loses by 5 or more the opposing creature realises the true nature of the trap.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The trap makes three attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.
The target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC16)

action.name: Crush
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the trap. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The armor is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the armor must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the armor remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal suit of armor.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While it is engulfing a creature, the Mortimer's Armor takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature engulfed by the Mortimer's Armor takes the other half.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The armor makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Doff {@recharge 5}
entries: The armor falls to pieces, readying the Don action. While in this state, it cannot perform regular Slam attacks.

action.name: Don
entries: The armor moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Medium or smaller humanoids' spaces. Whenever the armor enters a humanoid's space, the humanoid must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw.
On a successful save, the humanoid can choose to jump 5 feet back or to the side of the armor. A creature that chooses not to jump suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.
On a failed save, the armor enters the humanoid's space, and the humanoid takes 20 (606) bludgeoning damage and is
engulfed. The engulfed creature can breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and is affected by damage transference. When the armor moves, the engulfed humanoid moves with it.
An enguited humanoid can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 15} Strength check. On a success, the humanoid escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the armor.
Either way, the armor regains its form as a result of this action.
